subject: render qs in a web page
msgSnippet: I discovered rather pleasantly that this also works with messages from the shawalphabet group (which has a much greater volume of posts despite having far
messageBody:
I discovered rather pleasantly that this also works with messages from the shawalphabet
group (which has a much greater volume of posts despite having far fewer members).

Perhaps I will create a version which can spit out shavian too... and what is this uniscript of
which I have heard?

o

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "oliver langan" <oliverlangan@y...> wrote:
> I have just cobbled together a (very basic) script which should allow one to 'decrypt' QS
> text from anywhere, without having the correct fonts installed. basically, I render the
> words to images on the server, and show those. there are still some issues with it, but it
> seems to work for messages I copied and pasted from this forum.
>
> feel free to play with it and suggest imrovements. I can't promise I will get to them soon
> though...
> http://slate.langan.net/qs.php
>
> oliver
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Paige Gabhart" <pgabhart@a...> wrote:
> > Thanks for the reply. The interesting thing is the correct key strokes
> > are still embedded in the message. If one simply copies the message, it
> > can then be pasted into a word processor (assuming one has the proper
> > font, which was Kingsley in this case) and it will appear in QS. This
> > is not an elegant solution, but it works. I tried it with the copy of
> > my e-mail, and it is perfect. (see note below) So if someone wants to
> > send messages in QS, the rest of the group could read it and still use
> > it for practice reading if they don't mind copying it into their word
> > processor.
> >
> > Anyone interested?
> >
> >
> > Paige
> >
> > Note: Well, not perfect, as after I wrote it, I was still messing
> > around with the keyman keyboard mapping and managed, inadvertently, to
> > put in a mistake or two. I also left the namer dot off Mr. Colson's
> > name.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > [mailto:Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> > yahoo.5.haelo@s...
> > Sent: Saturday, August 13, 2005 7:12 PM
> > To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman
> > program using J. F. Colson's mapping
> >
> > It does not work via email, it seems, and this is one that
> > understands HTML email (unfortunately).
> >
> > -Av
> >
> > On 05225, at 1556, Paige Gabhart - pgabhart@a... wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > > Please let me know if the following comes through in the Kingsley
> > > font. It is my understanding that browsers may cause problems with
> > > this sort of thing. If it works, however, we could avoid the
> > > Ikonboard and the reported problems with spambots and still
> > > practice QS.
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > if His wxks, F wil bI mFtulI sxprFzd. His I-mEl waz ritan wi[T H /
> > > kINzlI foGt VzMN Ha kIbPd mApIMN devFzd bF mr kOlsan.
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > /pEJ

I discovered rather pleasantly that this also works with messages from the shawalphabet 
group (which has a much greater volume of posts despite having far fewer members).

Perhaps I will create a version which can spit out shavian too... and what is this uniscript of 
which I have heard?

o

> words to images on the server, and show those.  there are still some issues with it, but it 
> seems to work for messages I copied and pasted from this forum.

> feel free to play with it and suggest imrovements.  I can't promise I will get to them soon 
> though...

> oliver
